replication_study.hypothesis: Among districts in Afghanistan’s 2014 presidential election, the relationship between the 5-day election-period violence rate (SIGACT_5R) and the probability that a ballot-box is flagged as fraudulent by a last-digit forensic test is quadratic with a negative coefficient on the squared term (i.e., fraud first rises and then falls as violence increases).

data_plan.source_type: Merged administrative election returns, geocoded security-incident database (SIGACTS), and socio-economic covariates.
data_plan.wave_or_subset: 2014 Afghan presidential election, 5-day window around polling date.
data_plan.access_details: Openly provided in replication_data folder (no additional permissions required).

qualification.explanation: The dataset covers a different presidential election (2014) than the original (2009) yet is constructed with an identical workflow, allowing a strict out-of-sample test of the inverted-U claim.
qualification.similarity_to_original: Uses same forensic fraud indicator (last-digit test → ‘fraud’) and identical violence measures (SIGACT counts normalised by population) as described in original methods (post_registration.json → method.description; Stata code relabels variables exactly as original study).
qualification.deviation_from_original: Observations come from 2014 election rather than 2009 (file name and variable ‘elect’ distinguishes ‘1st’ vs ‘2nd Election’; replication_data file naming). Violence counts and socio-economic covariates updated to 2013/2014 population file (see columns pop_1314, electricp, tot_expend absent in original description).

data_plan.notes: fraud is stored as categorical strings ('Fraud'/'No Fraud'); needs recoding to 0/1. Missing values in electric-related covariates (~9.5%).

planned_method.steps: 1. Load CSV. 2. Recode fraud to binary. 3. Create squared violence term (SIGACT_5R^2). 4. Fit logistic regression: fraud ~ violence + violence^2 + controls. 5. Cluster SEs by Regional Command (REGCOM). 6. Extract and store coefficients and SEs. 7. Compare sign, magnitude and significance of violence^2 with original (expected negative, p<.05).
planned_method.models: Logistic regression (GLM binomial) with cluster-robust covariance.
planned_method.outcome_variable: fraud_bin (1 if ballot box flagged fraudulent, 0 otherwise).

planned_estimation_and_test.test: z-test from clustered SEs (p<0.05, two-tailed); direction expected negative.

planned_method.missing_data_handling: List-wise deletion (statsmodels default after dropping NA rows in model variables).
planned_method.inference_criteria: Replicated if coefficient on sigact_5r_sq is statistically <0 at 5% level and sign matches original.

files.replication_data/replicate_analysis_fixe: Loads 2014 dataset, prepares variables, runs clustered-SE logistic model, prints summary, and saves coefficients to /app/data/replication_coefficients.csv.

codebase.notes: Pure-Python rewrite of the provided Stata .do script, restricted to focal Model 1 (5-day window). All reads/writes inside /app/data.

analysis.comparison_metrics: Sign, magnitude and p-value of coefficient on violence squared; McFadden pseudo-R2; predicted marginal effects plot (optional).
